heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Exempted
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Exempted 

Traveller) (Covid-19) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2021.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited health act 1947 (exempted traveller) (covid-19) (amendment) (no 2) regulation 2021

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) (in so far as it relates to regulation 2(c))
heading: 2. The Health Act 1947 (Exempted Traveller) (Covid-19) Regulations
text_raw:
2. The Health Act 1947 (Exempted Traveller) (Covid-19) Regulations 

2021 (S.I. No. 134 of 2021) are amended - 

(a) by the insertion, in Regulation 2, of the following definition: 

“ ‘Sport Ireland certification’ means a written certification that 
is provided to a person by Sport Ireland under Regulation 9(11) 
of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) 
(Covid-19) (Restrictions upon Travel to the State from Certain 
States) (No. 5) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 135 of 2021);”, 

(b) by the insertion of the following Regulation after Regulation 6: 

“7. For the purposes of paragraph (j) of the definition of 
‘exempted traveller’ in section 38B(25) of the Act of 1947, a 
person is prescribed as an exempted traveller where the person - 

(a) holds a valid Sport Ireland certification, and 
(b) 

complies with any request of a relevant person or a 
member of the Garda Síochána under Regulation 8.”, 

and 

(c) by the insertion of the following Regulation after Regulation 7 

(inserted by paragraph (b)): 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 20th April, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [181] 3 

“8. A relevant person or a member of the Garda Síochána 
may request a person 
information or 
documentation as may be required in order to ascertain whether 
or not the person holds a valid Sport Ireland certification.”. 

to provide such 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 April, 2021. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [181]

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) (in so far as it relates to regulation 2(c))
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations amend Statutory Instrument No. 134 of 2021 and prescribe an 
additional exemption in that regard. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [181] 5
